title: New Business Location
name: new-business-location
description: As a Cafe, Restaurant or Bar, I am looking for commercial space in the City of Melbourne where I can open a new venue or extend my existing venue. I would like to know where similar businesses along, with their seating capacity, are located plus the density of residents and office workers in comparison.

title: Spot Parking Problem
name: spot-parking-problem
description: A city planner or goverment may want to locate the potential areas or city blocks where parking availability is underweight against the employment numbers and residetial dwellings, and plan to tackle the problem by extending public transportation.

title: Pedestrian Traffic Analysis
name: pedestrian-traffic-analysis
description: As a business owner, I want to know how much pedestrian foot traffic occurs in a potential new business location. I would like to be able to compare pedestrian traffic through the day, week and month. I would like to see visualisations that can help in deciding where I can start my new venture

title: Parking Availability
name: parking-availability
description: As a business that requires parking being available to either you or your customers, this will give you a great introduction to how a local business was able to solve their parking problems.

title: Bicycle Network Routes and Road Safety Part 1
name: bicycle-network-road-safety-part1
description: As a cyclist, I want a safe transport journey in the city of Melbourne. Which roads are safest to cycle on? As a council, we seek to invest in road safety initiatives which reduce the occurrences of accidents resulting in serious injuries of citizens using our road network. Where are accident hotspots for cyclists occurring?

title: Bicycle Network Routes and Road Safety Part 2
name: bicycle-network-road-safety-part2
description: As a cyclist, I want a safe transport journey in the city of Melbourne. Which roads are safest to cycle on? As a council, we seek to invest in road safety initiatives which reduce the occurrences of accidents resulting in serious injuries of citizens using our road network. Where are accident hotspots for cyclists occurring?

title: Ideal Green Wall Locations
name: ideal-green-wall-location-identification
description: This use case is designed for a city planner or goverment agent that may want to locate the ideal places around the city of Melbourne to install green walls. It may be beneficial to students as it provides examples of working with spatial databases utilising pandas, geopandas, shapefiles, socrata and folium.

title: Event Impacts and Effects on Pedestrian Traffic
name: event-disruption
description: My business relies on customer walk-ins. I want to understand the events or factors that influence pedestrian numbers near my business.

title: Pedestrian Network Routes and Road Safety Part 1
name: pedestrian-network-road-safety-part1
description: As a pedestrian I want a safe journey in Melbourne. Which intersections are safest and which are the riskiest from a road safety perspective? Where are accident hot-spots occurring and under what circumstance? As a council we want to invest in road safety initiatives which can effectively reduce serious injuries and fatalities. Are the current approaches to road network design having the impact we expected?

title: Ideal Green Roof Locations
name: greenroofs
description: As a city planner, I want to identify the locations which could most benefit from retrofitting with a green roof. As a building manager or owner of a residence, I want to visualise the potential of retrofitting my building for energy efficiency and greening. This use case visualises spatial databases using Geopandas.

title: Evaluate Business Location Using Pedestrian Traffic Day and Night
name: evaluate-business-location-using-pedestrian-traffic-day-night
description: As a business owner, I want to know how much pedestrian foot traffic occurs around me during the day and night, so that I can evaluate the suitability of the location and hours for my business. As a business owner, I want to know how much pedestrian foot traffic I get compared to surrounding areas, so that I can assess if it is better to adapt my hours, extend or move locations.

title: Environmental Sensor Study RevA
name: environmental-sensor-study-revA
description: As a city planner I want to determine the ideal number of environmental sensors for the city of Melb

title: Improving walkability in the City of Melbourne
name: usecase_walkability
description: As a resident or potential resident of the City of Melbourne, I want to identify how walkable a neighbourhood by viewing amenity density, access to public transport, or ease of walking.

title: Usecase-liveabilityanalysis
name: usecase-LiveabilityAnalysis
description: Individuals or families may be looking to move to Melbourne, and it is a high possibility they are u
